However, the time it takes for them to upload isn't as great. Also I'd like the idea of not having to have the app open in order for them to upload, that prevents me from multitasking which is a major minus-----. Also, it would be nice if the app once downloaded and recognize the faces of the ppl we have already set to a folder, would go to that folder automatically if that photo is a single of that person. Other than that this is a great app!!!
title: Great App but needs a little more tweaks!!

review: â¦if I could offer a suggestion to better the experience it would be to allow at a quick glance to give total of photos&to offer a quick option to edit certain photos at a glance without having to make each choice individually like with one click & eliminate all togetherâ¦an example would be the choice editing the post in the download fazeâ¦giving that option would be great for easy editing
title: ð¹â¦ð¸â¦this app is good but if there were different

review: I love this app and use it pretty much every day. A couple of things that need to be fixed are: 1. The app drops/deletes photos from your albums which you have carefully put together. This is very frustrating as you then have to add all missing photos from the album again. Is there an album overall limit Iâm not aware of? This needs to be fixed. 2. The video playback is awful regardless of the device you are using. I have several iPads including the most recent and all are the sameâ¦ slow video loading/playback. Therefore it is the app not the device Iâm using.
title: Great with some problems

review: I have no idea why the developers felt making it more difficult to see pictures on this date in history was a priority but here we are. With the new update there is no always present âthis day in historyâ icon to lead you to it. You are at the mercy of the app popping up a message to view them. The problem is is it isnât 100%. I have had multiple days now where it doesnât pop up the ability to look at past photos despite there being photos taken on those days. Why not just have the ability to always navigate to pictures from this day in history like on previous version? Devs got too cute and ruined the best feature of the app.
title: New update ruins this day in history

review: I was using google and it switched from unlimited to a shared 15gigs within its apps that I used which maxed out immediately when the switch happened, sadly I didnât know it was a shared 15gigs which really made inconvenient. As a Prime member I didnât use the option until googles limitations came to fruition. Once I switched and started checking it out simply the Storage is unlimited, Photos are easy to find with keyword searches, and it was an easy switch. Definitely recommend if you are a Prime member!
title: Great Perk

review: I have loved this app for years. It is great to store my photos, share with family members through the family vault, sort my photos in albums and I love the daily memories that pop up each day showing pictures from that day each year. However, I just recently updated the app and the update is so terrible! It makes it so much more difficult to maneuver, I cannot find the family vault any longer even after watching the new video to explain the updates (does not mention family vault at all in the video). Hi have used this app daily for the past 4.5 years and is one of the best benefits for a prime membership and it seriously makes me so sad now. Please please change the app back to how it was!
title: Hate the new update

review:
Nice belt and suspenders backup for camera roll and in between manual backup syncs to local storage.
I donât pay for the iCloud photos backup due to a 1.5 Tb library of Raw photos from DSLRâs and videos from iPhone. The time between manual syncs leaves a gap of potentially lost data in case of damaged or lost phone. So, letting this app pickup the captures in between is value added piece of mind. Plus the extra screen captures and daily snaps of deposits or grocery lists donât need to be saved in the roll once this is synced but can be useful if needed later.
title: Great extra backup with Prim free photo

review:
Iâve used it about two weeks. Upload was fast enough considering how many I had to put there. 

I feel very glad that my phone pictures are getting backed up at high resolution. I lost a year of photos from 2019 because I hadnât backed up and my phone crashed. This gives me disaster âwhat ifâ protection. 

Note doesnât fully back up Burst mode pictures. And has size limitations on videos which if you fill up does cost more to use even if you have prime. 

Excellent features like face recognition and sharing folders. Tested out making a group and having my cousin added their own picture easy Peasy. 

I also like that features so far seem equal on the phone app as in a browser. 

It could use some improvements in finding pictures based on different characteristics like all my Live Photoâs, all my png screenshots, all my selfies. It has just a few filters and with my initial upload of a bunch at once I had a hard time with narrowing.
title: Good so far

review:
I use to have folders and folders of photos saved to a computer desktop growing up. Times are changing and I donât have time to sit down and upload them to my laptop anymore. While itâs nice to still have that option, being able to upload photos on-the-go is a lot more desirable. And my photos can stay somewhere safe rather than on my phone.

The app is nice and clean. Easy to navigate. Does the job I was expecting. I do have one suggestion though regarding photo organization. 

Would there ever be a consideration to allow sub-albums inside of albums? For example: An album called âVacationsâ, and inside that album could be other albums like âDisneyland 2018â, âNew York 2019â, âBahamas Cruise 2020â, etc. That way I can more easily navigate which folders I want to get to. Iâll know my vacation photos are in one album, hiking photos in another, work events in another, and so on. 

So far Iâm enjoying the app.
title: Excited to see where this goes

review: This app would be perfect if I could actually organize my pictures. Keeping thousands of pictures in one big folder just isnât a realistic way to to organize everything. Sure you can make albums but without being able to actually move pics to there own folders itâs impossible to keep track of everything. This needs a better way to organize everything. Basically create folders and move pictures. Not one big messy collection with albums.
title: I love this app but.......

review:
Just to start off this is the best cloud photo storage app out there but here is my critique:
Without Prime you get 5gigs photos or videos
With Prime you get unlimited photos and 5 gig photos. I think this is fine. I just wish that if I were to cancel my prime account I know how much storage my photos take up. I am wondering if I cancel prime, do all the photos or videos that take up more than 5 gigs get thrown into the void. Making sure my photos are safe in any situation is important because they hold your life story.
title: Best option out there for cloud photos

review: Itâs such an awesome alternative to Cloud storage, which I personally run out very quickly off ð¤ª it has the same options and functionality as IPhotos, showing in retrospective what photos you took over the years on certain days, you can easily make theme photo albums (like Birthday Parties for kids over the years!), find specific photos based on description (pets or others) and might as well use it for FREE, if you already have Prime membership! â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸
title: Great app for your Photos!

review: I was unaware that this app had saved any photos of mine, nor did I know it existed and ran on my former device. Aside from the fact that I am a staunch opponent of Besos and the way he treats the ' Peasants' that get your precious new junk to you on time, alst' while collecting all of our data for nefarious purposes-lm glad something is keeping my memories in one place. Bc though I'm still young, I'm quickly losing them.
title: Amazonian Relics

review: Love having this app although Iâve had to remove it and add it back again to keep working correctly. Samsung doesnât have this problem, which is my only complaint. Hopefully, the developers will get it right.
title: Alloowas you to keep your memories

review:
This app is bar none the best Photo uploading app I have ever used, itâs even better than the popular competitor. 

This app supports Live Photo, uploads fast and it actually displays photo storage size during the upload and gives a progress bar for each upload, which i think is a really nice touch. All photos are stored in original quality and upload for free with a Prime subscription. Videos are limited to 5GB but thatâs fine since this app is really best suited for photo backup. 

Thanks for making a great app.
title: The best photo uploading app ever

review: Iâd love to see ways I can store photos into folders, âfamilyâ âhomeâ âvacationsâ folders.  and search by color and name - red dress, blue ring , etcâ¦ Sabrina , Sophie , etcâ¦to find people by searching name. I want to label photos- Sabrina or red dress- and find it easily- also, in favorites , Iâd like to search for some with a word to find it . Black dress or beach . And it finds it so I donât have to scroll through favorites - when I search by the year and month , Iâd also like to search by the date. December 2022, 12th- 15th.
title: Great! ð«

title: Itâs a nobrainer.

review: But maybe some more artistic and creative in app features like more custom views and layouts like mosaic vies based on original dimension layouts...a light table slide view, maybe similar abridged to itâs more fundamental features seen in more complex, feature rich applications and phot platforms offered by more expensive and more tailored to photographers and post camera roll digital photo developers. title: Very Functional

review: This membership benefit has been a game changer for me. In the past, I used a cloud storage app for my photos of which. was free.  When my photo collection exceeded the amount allotted for the free account, I found myself paying close to the same amount that I paid for Prime. Why pay more? So I consolidated my print collection and have never looked back. All photos are uploaded automatically at full resolution. I can access every photo Iâve taken quickly in Albums anywhere
title: Convenient, Easy to use & a No Brainer Decision for Prime Members

review: My biggest beef is whatever is used to provide the weather. It can be really dark at my house where the trees are practically touching the ground and itâs pouring but Alexa will tell me thereâs no rain in the forecast or thereâs like a 11% chance. If I ask Google it tells me that it is raining and when it will be expected to stop. At this current time I asked if it was going to rain and she said no there is only an 11% chance but yet I received a thunderstorm warning for our area and itâs currently pouring outside.
title: Weather is not right 50% of time

review: So far, I am enjoying this very much because Iâm finding all these photos that I have saved on flash drives in here as well without me intentionally putting them in here. They are just here. Iâm very grateful because I found some that I thought I had lost. And I found some I couldnât even remember having. One question I have is the size of the images and if they are the same size as they were when they went in. Thanks. I appreciate this app.
title: Surprisingly Good

The photos transfer very quickly.  My only issue was with my videos filling up the allotted space.  I know there is a fix for this but I havenât had the opportunity to check it out yet. title: Great app for use with iPhone and iPad

review:
I wanted a 2nd back up in case photos disappeared from iCloud when I upload them from iPad / iPhone to a flash drive. 

I only wish there were a reassuring msg to let you know that âuploading will resume shortlyâ  when you have to interrupt it. 
Also a little confusing as the app shows a different ânumber of photos left to uploadâ in different places; One place now says it has 110 more to go, the screen where you switch to âovernightâ mode says 5097. 
   Itâs actually very fast & convenient!
title: Itâs a lifesaver !

Some photos, that are cropped in my photo storage, are stored into the app un-cropped. When I try to edit the photos through the app, sometimes it will not save and I canât leave the editing. So I have to close the app out and try again and sometimes it will do it again. Other than that, this is a great app to backup all of your photos and videos.
title: Awesome backup storage, but some photo edit issues

review: This app is superb. Firstly, it has a clean, smooth, and intuitive UI, which is the core of every app. Secondly, it has all the features Appleâs app has, plus more like overnight upload, UNLIMITED, full-resolution cloud photo storage with Prime, and complimentary 5 GB video storage (more purchasable). Thirdly, every aspect of this app is detailed and works flawlessly. A drawback is that you cannot edit photos or videos, though, personally, I seldom edit, so it barely affects the app's rating.

review: I havenât been able to put my photos anywhere and I keep having to buy space for my phone ð¥² but now I donât have to worry about loosing my photos or paying for extra storage ð and yes I have tried to upload and download my photos on other things but this is my game changer for my memoryâsð my phone wiped it twice and I lost so many memories and Iâm just thankful I donât have to worry about it anymore ð 10/10 am recommending
title: Honestly thank you

title: Eases the worry of losing pictures!

review: Not as user friendly as it use to be. I do not like the premde filters to help find pictures it says QUICKLY! review:

title: Great App

review:
Works good for me, the only complaint I have which is super minor, I can only upload when app is open or I could do the overnight upload, but Iâd still have to open the app and start it and then go to bed and itâll do it while ya sleep

Thatâs a super minor thing though, I love the app if works great for me, I like using apple photos and this app for all my pics, just to have all my pics in two different locations itâs super cheap Iâm overall happy
title: Works good for me

review: Do recently one of my hard drives went haywire and it seems Iâve lost most of my daughterâs first year pictures. I was upset. However, Iâd forgotten that some of my images get backed up automatically on this app. Today I got the notification that there were images from this day a year ago that it wanted me to see. title: Great App for forgotten archives

review: I donât understand why itâs so difficult to figure out how to upload photos. There is a large plus symbol but thatâs to add an album. When you open an album and tap the three dots, select add to album, you only have the option to add photos you already have uploaded. I shouldnât have to search a help section to know how to upload photos. I do not want to give permission to upload every photo. Other photo apps make uploading easy with one tap and not having to go through your settings. Iâm pretty disappointed.
title: Uploading photos

review:
As others have pointed out, the app uploads photos as soon as they are take but not after they have been edited in your computer or other device. This makes the app pretty useless for anyone who does more than just take snapshots. 

It would help if there were just a switch to turn off that auto upload feature. That is not a hard thing to do from an engineering point of view. But, of course, it is possible users will then flip on that switch and start loosing their snapshots. The cries of dismay! 

So, I may have to reconsider my cloud storage options. There are no free lunches.
title: Cannot control uploads

review: This is a good substitute for other photo saving apps. It has good searchability, and has other features I havenât really tried yet. Sometimes my photos are not all there and I have to open the app and wait for it to completely download. Otherwise, I have no issues with it.
title: Yay! A place to save photos

title: Love it & Very Helpful

review: Iâve been wanting to get off social media for some time, but my excuse was always that I wouldnât have anywhere to keep my precious photos, and I take A LOT of photos. So when I discovered AmazonPhotos I was sold instantly. I LOVE this app! I love that I can create albums the same way I would to organize things on social media platforms. I also canât wait to print my favorite photos directly from the app! Thatâs just way too cool! And the app is FREE and UNLIMITED!? Come on!
title: Game Changer

I love the face detector feature so it knows who is in the picture and the search bar. The sharing features are great and allows me to share albums and updated pictures of my child with extended family members who canât see her regularly. I recommend this app to everyone!
title: Organizes all my photos so I donât have to!

review: I seriously am in love with this app! You can set for it to upload when opening the app. The only downfall is that you canât close the app till itâs done or it will stop the uploading but if you have quick enough WiFi it only takes a minutes. I personally prefer it over icloud for the sake that if I delete the photos from my phone, the items stay in the app and you can have the app downloaded on multiple devices to access the pictures!
title: Been a lifesaver!

review: Absolutely love this app, great way to back up the (way to many) photos I take. Love that it has a shareable feature, my husband takes pictures that I don't, and it's great. Only thing I don't like is that I have to open it and let it sit there to sync up, even though I have that enabled. When doing that, I can't even switch to another screen. It occasionally spazzes out and says that it's uploading -- photos when it's done, but it's a free app, that sorts photos! I can't complain!
title: Great App! Love the photo Storage

review: Almost nothing about this app is user-friendly. You get notifications over the area that youâre working in so when you click on, letâs say the delete button there is a banner blocking it from the last photo that you deleted.  There are multiple issues with choosing and selecting certain photos and the app not responding or theyâre being an issue why you canât select certain photos. Itâs way too difficult to delete multiple photos at once. I get so frustrated whenever Iâm in this app that I end up closing out of it and not even doing any work in it
title: Needs redesigned

review: This app saves all your pictures ..there is so much space for all your pics ..itâs also awesome to have when changing devices .. no more worries about losing your photos ..and can be used on multiple devices without any problems ..easy to navigate ..nice layout ..not to mention it also has on this day looking back where it sends you memories of the past years and slide shows of the past year
title: Love this app

review:
Maybe if you have a very limited list on photos, it easier but in no way for me. I use folders to pre-organize images.  As of v.8, I canât find the folder list anymore.  

There used to be a great search text box which seems to be replaced by buttons such as places and thinks. This is not simplistic anywhere near as simplistic. It was much more simplistic to just type âdogâ in the search then it is to scroll through hundreds of âthingsâ to hopefully find dog. 

This is no longer an app to organize thousands of files from over a decade.  If the features are not brought back soon, it will be time to cancel service and find another solution.
title: App near useless since v.8.

review: Itâs not as feature-rich as something like Flickr, but if youâre already paying for Prime itâs a no-brainer to use this to backup your photos. Unlimited photo storage is the draw, though you have to pay extra for video storage. I wish it had a setting to prevent it from uploading videos, which is why I took off a star. Other than that it does what it advertises and I ha w no complaints. The âon this dateâ feature is fun, to see what you you were doing on this date years ago.
title: Bare bones, but very good

review: The app itself is reasonably easy to use and reliable, though should offer more control of the uploading process such as selection of which photos rather than mass uploading. The worst part of the app is the huge number of notifications turned on by default, practically taking over my phone. The worst experience of all was the pop up of whether I liked the app or not with only a Yes or No option, freezing my experience in the app until tapping through an annoying series of interactions. I would not have provided a negative review if it were not for this prompt that interrupted my time in the app.
title: Decent app but constantly nagging

review:
I have been dis outages to use memory as the first iterations of âalbumsâ contained  random photos from my database that I do not particularly cared for: either the angle, or subject, etc was not memorable for me. 
Like FB or Instagram, please a have a feature where you can select your favorite photos and have those photos being part of the memory collection. That would be very meaningful and will make the collection stand out, that I would enjoy looking at overtime and share it with my loved ones.
title: Suggestion

review: Unlimited full res photos is an awesome deal for prime members. This is the prime benefit I tell everyone that they have-and-probably-didnât-know. Besides just storage, it has all main features of Google Photos. I think it might be missing some of the artistic creations though. I also like that you can install and use app without giving permissions to your photos if you want (to just view), Google Photos requires access to local photos or else it wonât even open.
title: All around great

review: This app would be greatâ¦ if it worked. The app is constantly failing to perform. Overnight uploads is always a joke. You have to close the app and reopen about 5 times before it will start correctly uploading so you can leave it alone to do the overnight uploads. And even then, it sometimes will close out while youâre sleeping for no reason. Except when it wonât work at all. As of today 9/10, I havenât been able to upload anything since 9/1. I pay extra each month to have this as my backup for photos and videos. But how is this an efficient backup if it fails to upload my pictures and video on a regular basis???
title: Great in theory, horrible in execution

review:
The new app design is obviously designed with light users in mind, to have a more modern esthetic. However, they have removed any option to search by text string. In fact, it only allows you to browse your photos by their pre-determined bot-generated categories, or to scroll though your entire collection chronologically. Mainly it just wants to feed you the photos itâs algorithm regurgitates at any given moment. 

I have a large collection. Previous to this latest update, I could search for and locate a specific photo in seconds. Now I can barely find anything I am looking for.  This app is now useless for my needs.
title: New app update no longer has Search option

review: I love this app. What an easy way to organize all of my photos! Plus it saves so much room on my phones memory. One thing Iâd like to see, is a notification pop up that lets me know Iâve already added a photo to an album. Itâs hard to keep track if you do a lot. For instance.. Iâm currently undergoing an exterior home reno and created an album. Iâm constantly taking pics and canât keep up whether I added it to album or not. Something like âYouâve already added this to album: RENOVATIONâ. But regardless.. itâs a great app !!
title: Easy and highly functional

review: I only have 5 GB of storage on my phone so I canât hold many pictures. I got this app to see if maybe it could store more pictures and I could delete things off my camera roll to make more space but still be able to have these photos. I have over 1,600 photos uploaded on the app and I still have 2 full GB left which is perfect. Great app to store more photos and videos!!! Definitely recommend this app for everyone!
title: Love Love Love

review: I love being able to have another place to store photos and also easily order prints. The other amazing thing is that I have it as a screensaver for all our TVs in the house with the fire stick. So we get so see our amazing family photos on our big TVs. Waking in a room and seeing my adorable granddaughters photos is better then walking in a room and seeing the television on some stupid commercial!  We find ourselves not turning a program on until the slide show is over!! Lol
title: Love it!!

review: I tell everyone I know about this app! Itâs a blessing to have somewhere to safely store your videos & pictures! I love using with my Echo Show as a digital frame!! The only negative thing is the âpeopleâ at the bottomâ¦.you canât see them well. Always a helpful thing when you need pictures  for a  birthday, a death or looking for a specific picture to look for the person & then all the photos pop up! Just please change them back to large tiles so we can use this perk ð
title: Love love love this app!

review:
Removing the search function from the app is a severe setback. I canât even find pictures of my cats any longer because 1) I canât simply search for âcatâ like I used to and 2) when I go filter by âthingâ cat is not an option, but you donât even know this because you have to go through the whole list of prefiltered options (which are meaningless to my use and experience). 
Suggestion: stop thinking you know what the customer wants and give the customer options to filter their photos as theyâd like.
title: Bring back search function

review: Super convenient to access all my photos and sync all my devices from anywhere with an internet connection but the facial recognition feature needs attention. Currently it is unable to unassociate incorrect facial recognition, unable to tag, and unable to bypass people in the background.  The search also works well for the items picture but not for the pictures info such as basic file attributes.  So, I really like the app but would like to love it if these features were better developed.
title: Would like to love it

review:
I use this for my big storage of photos, but I wish I could save all my videos! I still pay Dropbox for that. My daughter is a singer, so I have every performance of hers saved on video. There isnât an option to upgrade video storage here, either, which is unfortunate. 

Sorting & storing photos is better than it used to be, but searching is a bit clumsy. I have just gotten to where I use this as my âset & forgetâ backup for photos... it backs up daily & I only use it for photos. I have to manually back up my videos to Dropbox, but at least I have that organized better.
title: Generally great, but...

review: I like it a lot except when I first downloaded it I had to get 3000+ photos off my phone. It downloaded some but not all. Now I have to sort through which were downloaded and which I canât delete off my phone yet. Going forward it should be easy to keep track of but not easy in the beginning. I also like that it will keep photos from both my husbandâs phone and mine so all of them are in 1 location.
title: Great except it doesnât delete photos off device

review: I love Prime Photos! I use iCloud as well, but donât feel confident that itâs backing everything up, even though I pay for additional storage. Prime backs up without fail when I open the app and am connected to Wi-Fi. I love the ability to sort and search too, also the ease of downloading and sharing. Very user friendly! I also love the unlimited storage for photos. Hands down, this is the best cloud storage for photos and videos. I highly recommend it!
title: Best Cloud service for photos!

review:
Things work exceptionally well until I found two bugs. 
1. It kept showing xx photos left for backup even though I have enough video storage left. Not sure if this is related with IOS 11 as those photos were taken with my new iPhone 8 plus. 
2. The combine faces feature does not work for me. I could select faces to combine and was asked to enter name for the person. However, the âOKâ is not clickable so I have to click cancel to go back.
Not sure if anyone has either of the same issue.
title: Love everything except some bugs

review:
Great storage only problem is when I want to get in touch with somebody do you have a question or add to my storage I donât know who to call .
It says unlimited pictures, which is not true. I understand if they cannot upload my videos and there is a limit to that but pictures are unlimited and this is not the fact I have prime photos for past five years at least or maybe more and they havenât been uploaded for past two years, itâs keep pausing the upload for the pictures and it says you have to buy more storage which this is not what Prime is all about
title: Great

review:
I love that my photos and videos are automatically backed up at a much more affordable price than similar offerings from Apple. 

Unfortunately, the app experience is pretty poor.  Videos often fail to load, some random Live Photos wonât play for no apparent reason, and the app completely freezes often and you have to restart and find where you were before to continue.  

These problems have existed for years now and those bugs should have been squashed by now.
title: Love the service, but the app needs work.

review:
Unlimited photo and 5 gig of video storage? Canât beat it!
I used this for transferring my photos and videos from my Samsung Galaxy into my new iPhone. For anyone whoâs switched that direction (droid to iOS) you know Apple doesnât make it easy. Install the app, upload, install the app, download. Simple!
I canât attest to the printing service, yet, but the prices seem pretty good. Iâm looking forward to (finally) getting some prints made.
title: Great service for Prime Member

review: I spend a lot of time preserving memories and Iâm grateful for the ease of saving pictures.  However, printing can be frustrating at times.  The edit/crop/rotate doesnât always work.  Also there is a check mark in the upper right hand corner and a done in the bottom right corner.  There have been times I clicked on âdoneâ thinking it meant I was done with my selection/editing or by accident and I lose all of the pictures I just edited.  (But that is partially user error.)
title: Love the ease of saving pictures but printing can be difficult

review:
The quality and quantity of photos stored is excellent! It is easy to access and forward, email or share. Perhaps too easy to share as usually others can access all your photos whether you select and remove the qualifying hashtags to see all Photos, or not!  This can
Be a privacy issue so check what you're doing and where you save the photos; it is better to send from separate albums you create.
Otherwise useful photo storage app.
title: Great app but too easy for others to access all photos not just selected

review: I started using the app as a way to back up photos. My biggest complaint is that seemingly the only way to add more space by upgrading my subscription is to cancel, wait for it to expire, then re-subscribe. That makes me nervous when itâs my photos at stake if I forget to sign back up. It would be nice to be able to pick a new plan and have it automatically start when the old plan expires. Iâm trying to give more money and you make it difficult. Makes it tempting to just pay for iCloud insteadâ¦

title: So convenient

review: This was my first time ordering online and I was very pleased with my photos so I will be back and older and more. title: Photos

review: Itâs not the most elegant photos app, but it integrates well with your Echo Show display and has unlimited free photo backup from your phone. My wife loves it â¥ï¸
title: Prime member must have

review:
I wanted to use this as my key photo backup and organization app since I have a prime account, but this app doesnât have even the basic of photo organization features. I would expect at least a property editor for photo name or manual entry of tags, which would then allow me to search for photos by said tags. But this app is purely just a upload and manual visual search app, which is not useful if you have tons of pictures.

title: Missing a lot of key features: Canât change title, add custom tags

review: I like having my photos in the cloud and use them for my screensaver on my fire tv. It should give you an option to not upload videos because it tells me on my phone that it has paused uploads due to running out of video room. But I thought photos were unlimited so Iâm confused. title: It all good.

review: If you have prime this is one of the best features that you could use. You could save all your photos at the maximum resolution. title: Excellent value with prime

review:

Keep up the good work and please donât change anything as itâs great for us elderly people to use.
title: Handy & easy to use

review: The new 8.0 update has been touted as as making it easier than ever to find your photos. I disagree. I find the navigation counter intuitive. The old âsearchâ bar was magical! I could type âSedonaâ and see all photos taken in Sedona Arizona. Now, I have to scroll though a forever list of metadata.  Then, to do something simple, like create a slide show of all images in an albumâ¦ good luck. Canât figure that out either. Itâs so disappointing because I love this feature of Prime, but I want the old app backâ¦
title: Love the storage, navigation is horrible

review: Thatâs the worst re-design Iâve ever experienced, not intuitive and lacking important features that the previous app had. The claim in the update description states that itâs now easier to find photos the user is looking for, and the redesigned app doesnât have a normal search anymore. I tried to find pics from a certain year and location that I was able to do within seconds before, spending several minutes, but still couldnât find the place in the new places offerings. Removing a simple search functionality is a deal-breaker for me, and Iâll start looking for an alternative to manage my photos.
title: Awful redesign

review: The app is nice. It could be nicer with a few improvements. I have pics on several different devices, so not sure what Iâve uploaded and not. Maybe it can and I just havenât found the feature idk. Also, lately I have been getting a lot of âunable to downloadâ messages when trying to download a photo to my phone.... its annoying, please resolve it. Otherwise, great app.
title: Good but needs work

review: Basically I like the app as long as I have an internet connection (I don't have unlimited data and don't want to use it to upload photos). Being able to upload photos when I'm traveling gives me a sense of security and let's me keep my phone clear for taking more photos. Too slow to download to the phone though so I wait till I get home to pick out those special pics. And, since it comes with Prime I may as well use it rather than pay some other service.
title: A bit slow from phone

review:
I LOVE this ability to organize & archive our photos in the cloud. A couple of suggestions would get you my 5th star . . .

â¢ Thank you for allowing me to have my family join me. It would be better if ALL of us could see, share, & organize the albums. (I was shocked when we couldnât.)

â¢ If we could edit the date & location info on photos. Everything comes in as today where I currently am, but weâre often converting old photos to digital & it would be great if we could change the data to what it actually was.

â¢ Along the same lines, itâd be great if there was a way to attach a note to a photo - like the notes my mom wrote on the back. Some of the notation would be accomplished by tagging whoâs in the photo & editing the date & location. But a note field would allow us to capture things like âready for the raceâ or whatever.
title: Wonderful App

review: I started using this ap as a free promotional thing. Never thought I would ever need it. Long story short someone stole my phone my iPhone stopped saving my photos to the cloud because I didnât pay for storage & I thought all of my new born babies pictures were gone for life. I remembered I downloaded this checked & they are all on here & I am beyond thankful that I have those memories forever now. Thank you

title: Donât get if your mat at home

title: Photo

I have three sons with very, very  similar features, and their sister does as well. title: Itâs amazing when it wants to be

review: I downloaded this app to store photos from my phone. Itâs very easy to use in that regard and is able to accommodate all my photos, however, it has very limited video storage. I do love the memories feature (showing photos that were taken on this day in previous years), but I think it has a long way to go when it comes to sharing those photos. I canât seem to pull them up to edit them or view them full sized. All in all, itâs a nice free app that stores my photos safely.

review: The title says it. We use this app for family photo storage going back decades. The next additional feature is the "this day in history" where you see photos from prior years. It used to be such that all people h hooked in to the account could use this feature, but a recent update made it so only the primary account holder can see it. Mom and grandma are not impressed. Iâd raise my review back to five stars if they added the feature back in. Beyond that Iâm not convinced itâs any better or worse than any other photo storage app.
title: Latest update removed memories for family members

review: I am a grandma who loves to take pictures of my kids and grands! I use my phone to take my pictures and they save right into the app. I have printed 5x7 and 4x6 and the come out beautifully. The colors are wonderful and it lets you know if the picture would be blurry. Hands down better than going to a store, connecting your phone and trying to print! I will never do that again!
title: Easy to print

review: This update is a joke! The worst update ever! I would give it zero stars if I could!! I used to love being able to go back and find old photos, but since this update I canât find anything I am looking for. No search button??? Such a shocker in this day and age. Terrible terrible idea!  Canned words that have nothing to do with what I am looking for?  I couldnât even find the word horse!  Such huge leap backwards and the ultimate disappointment.  This is utter garbage ! Who would think this is ok? If you were forced to do it this way, why not at least have the words alphabetical so you could find anything ? Huge mistake! Itâs free and I want my money back!
title: Hot steaming garbage!!!

review:

review:
The memories section just stopped working and wonât load anymore. I get a loading error message every time I try. Also the this day in the past also always fails to load for me. Update: logging in again fixed the problems.
title: Broken, needs work

review:
I love it as a back up to my iphone, my iCloud tends to get full pretty promptly so itâs easy to delete pictures knowing that they are backed up on here. Itâs great being able to have my picture show up on our TV as a screen saver especially order memories, it's like have a giant electronic picture frame. 
Overall a great app, would had given it a 5 star review, however it be wonderful if it would also include unlimited video backup as well.
title: Great photo storage

review: The ability to have your photos accessible to share on all your devices is a big plus, and the facial recognition is great, but a little glitchy. Unfortunately, thereâs no ability to attach descriptions to a photo without inserting text into the picture itself. Also, while you can assign the date the picture was taken, but you canât state the date simply as a year or month; it requires a specific day, which implies a degree of accuracy that might not be known.
title: Room for improvement

review: This was formerly a useful good app but the latest release turned it into a crappy slideshow generator. With the latest pathetic release, you can no longer search for a keyboard of your choosing. You can filter to a few preselected and inane terms, like âplantâ or âbikiniâ, but you canât pick your own search word like âappleâ or âtractorâ. If you need to find a specific photo out of thousands, you are out of luck, the new version makes this impossible. I canât believe the designers could blunder this badly and treat the users with such disrespect. This is no longer a viable phone app, it is now pointlessly and thoughtlessly broken.
title: App ruined by removal of search function

review: I have prime through my student discount and it's honestly the best thing ever. Years ago I used to use Photobucket to save pictures, but that was a huge hassle. title: Peace of mind!

review: Itâs easy to use and saving beautiful memories of wife makes me feel so happy and blessed thank you I miss my wife every single second of each day but thank you for helping me with this and showing a memory every day gives me a big smile and my my heart feel the love we always have for each other and also always stronger than ever until I see my Jacqueline again thank you

review: This app may be enough for majority of people, but for photographers there is still a lot to be desired.  The metadata of the images in this app only shows basic information like date and filename, and thatâs it.  Compared to Google Photos, Google provides more metadata info like focal range, iso, aperture, and camera model, and all these info are searchable in app.  So, if image metadata is important to you, then look somewhere else.  But if you just want to backup your images, then this app should be fine.
title: Need more details in image metadata

review: Iâve been looking for photo storage for awhile and even though I have prime, I thought I had to pay for it. Turns out I donât for photos but I did have to buy extra storage for my videos (reason for 4 stars). Other than that, I think itâs a great app. It stores my photos which is exactly what I need. I also like how it automatically backs up the photos in my phone. Iâve used it to edit photos and download them and both work fine.

review:
I am indebted to Prime Photos. I downloaded on my new phone and photos and videos came back that I had forgotten about or couldnât remember even taking. Like my youngest daughter baby shower of her first and only child. Pictures of my oldest grandchildren that was forgotten. 
Thank you Prime Photos for bringing some joy back into my Life during the times when I couldnât see my family up close and personal.

title: Memories

review:
I love this so far . the only thing keepin it from getting the 5th star is that the fire stick can only be set to start  the slide show   5,10, or 15 minutes after no  activity. (or never) .

but it did really help me organize my thousands of photos .

review: The previous version of the app, while not entirely intuitive, was functional and worked fine. The recent update makes it harder to find photo streams. Also, it looks like thereâs a bug, because now thereâs no way to like individual photos. When you like a photo, it likes all photos for that post. Once you like a photo, thereâs also an indicator saying thereâs a comment on the photo even when thereâs no comment. I wish they would have stuck with the previous interface and just integrated the machine learning on top of it rather than trying to completely redesign the UI.
title: Why the âupgradeâ?

review: This app works great for streaming your photos to a Fire TV!  We have thousands of photos that were just sitting on or iPhones and iPads.  I wanted a device where I could just glance up while walking by and see my kids, grandkids or places weâd traveled and just be reminded at random, of our lives!  This is perfection! title: Think long and hard before you do this...

review:
Really thereâs only a couple things Iâd like that others already mentioned..  it would be good to be able to correct the face recognition when itâs wrong. This happens often. And it would be nice to be able to rotate the image from the app. (Great if it, like google, actually pointed out the pics that might need a flip). To delete pics from the main area when making albums. And to alert to duplicate photos being stored/about to be stored. 

The one thing I donât see others mentioning that really is my biggest prob with this app, is the having to leave the app open fir it to store/upload my photos. Thatâs a real PITA. Canât it happen in the background? As a pic is taken?

I use this because I get it with prime. But it is my backup of a back up. (Google photos  is just a better app at this point.)
title: Mostly fine

review: I like the unlimited photo storage for Prime members.  The app is fine for that purpose, but it could use a number of features to really make it a useful tool. Also, album sorting options would be great beyond the two offered.  Reverse chronological order, reverse file name, etc.  drag and drop sorting would be nice, as well.

Support seems to think theyâre helping by continually sending either 1. The old instructions for individually uploading which donât work anymore or 2. Instructions for batch uploading all photos. review: This app has given my family cherished memories that at times we have forgotten and then on certain days it reminds us and brings a smile to our faces and floods those memories back to us and we sit and talk about that day or that moment, we would like to say thank you for helping us to remember to slow down at times and just take in the moments that we have and hold them a little closer and keep them in our hearts.

review:

Searching is incredibly easy you can search by date or for an individualâs face. This will help you find the photo you are looking for quickly.
My favorite feature is memories the app will surprise you periodically with a âthis day â itâll send you a notification that contains all the pictures from a date in your photo catalog. 

There is however one downside to this app. If your service is spotty it takes a long time to load all of your photos. I feel the ease of uploading the photos counters the lag in certain situations.

Overall this product has been a great boon to our family members. Itâs easy to use for everyone and you can share memories easily.

  Also the app somehow deleted all of my hidden pictures. It said they were backed up, so I deleted the photos. Went back to find the photos a week or two later, and they were gone. Very sad, considering that was all the personal photos from my honeymoon.

review: I just downloaded this app so it wonât be fair to give it an honest rating while Iâm still trying to understand what makes it different from Google or other picture apps I have Iâm still trying to learn what makes it standout right now I donât see much of a difference think it might be different but maybe I donât know how to maneuver my way around.

                                       Michael

2. Allow editing of metadata, specifically photo date. Some edited old photos/videos show up as new photos, would be great to be able to get them back in the proper place in the timeline. 

With these enhancements, would be 5 stars from me!

Loves to crash while backing up pix. 

Also, is backing up well beyond 3x the amount of pix on my device. Some months ago, photos were all backed up, then one day the app doubled how many pics it "thought" I had, and as of today it's more than tripled. So, let's say I have a hundred pix (I have a lot more), at some point it started telling me that it had backed up those pix but has 100 more to finish backing up. Now it's telling me it has nearly 450 pix yet to back up and 400 pix are backed up successfully. But I only have (in this simplified example) 100 pics on my phone to back up. 

Maybe it has trouble with large libraries. 

Also, backing up is very slow. 

Will address other bugs I've found by updating this review when these, the largest of issues, are resolved.

review:
Great app and great features but lacks the biggest privacy concern. 

No password/face ID option to open the app and to view the photos. 

If someone can access your phone then they can access all your photos. Not just photos in your phone but all the photos in a whole. Photos that are not present in the phone but backed up in the previous/other phone can be easily accessed without any authentication. 

A simple login password/Face ID can overcome this issue. 

If featured, will surely be a 5 star app.
title: Biggest privacy concern. No login security.

review:
Very poorly written ap.  
When you look at a photo, there is no information as to where it is taken or if it has identified any people in the photo. 
Instead you have look in the places area or the people area. 
The people area shows every face seen in a photo whether you know them or not. You cannot hide unknown faces. 

If you just want free storage, then itâs great, but if you care about where it was taken and the identity of faces, then go to Google or Apple.

review:
Ever since running the recent update none of my photos backed up are shown within the app. It says that everything is backed up but all that is shown is empty frames. I have restarted my device, checked my internet connection and all routine things, I have even tried to re-download some photos but it tells me theyâre already downloaded even though I canât see them. Thank goodness I also use google photos otherwise it seems I would not be able to recover my pictures. Clearly there is a bug with this update that needs fixing
UPDATE MAY 2021
Thankfully the bugs are fixed and everything seems to be good. I still use alternative clouds âjust in caseâ
title: No photos displayed since updating

review:
This App has really changed the way I use my phone. I have always suffered with limited phone storage so would hold off taking photos where I normally would, with the app it automatically uploads your photo library, then picks any new media when opening the app afterwards. I can then go back and delete my older photos on my phone to create free space, as the app has unlimited photo storage with Prime membership. It also has a desktop version which Iâve been able to upload my older photos from other phones and also a camera I own creating a centralised photo album of all of my photos ever.

The only issues with the app is it doesnât have any way to sort or filter on albums, with places, dates, people, scenery etc which would be very useful as a search tool. Also having a limited storage 5GB space for video is also annoying, as it fills up much more quickly than youâd realise.
title: Versatile App and Free with Prime

review:
Cannot fault this. You can filter by day-week-month-year. The face recognition is incredible and you can choose pics by person, perfect for a birthday or anniversary. It also filters places, so you can do a montage for where you have visited. I love the âon this dayâ prompt -
It not only allows you to see memories but is also a reminder to back up from the last time you backed up. I do this daily now and it takes no time at all.  
I have full faith in knowing that if my phone is ever lost, all my pics and videos are safe.
title: Perfect backup

review:
On the photo side of things I canât fault this app at all. I love the way it automatically uploads old pics with the date actually taken and on the odd occasion this doesnât work you can change this. 
It downloads Live Photoâs from your iPhone and you can edit in the app. To top it off the memories from previous years is just genius â¤ï¸ 
The only reason I havenât given 5 stars is the video side of things - 5gb really isnât much, I would happily pay to increase just the video capacity however this doesnât appear to be an option and as a prime member I already have unlimited photos, Iâm not willing or able to pay even more to increase the whole app.
title: Fabulous app

review: Does the job, but the UI leaves a lot to be desired on the iPad. The interface feels like an oversized mobile app, with large buttons hidden behind swipe menus. Some functions do not make sense; for example, to upload pictures to an album, you must first exit the albums view, tap an options menu, select the pictures to upload. After the upload is complete, you then have to go back to the albums view, tap the button to create a new album, select the same pictures again and only then can you actually create an album. There are also no keyboard shortcuts and the app cannot run side-by-side with other apps.
title: Works, but poor interface

review: I have had the app the whole time I have had this phone, and I have never been disappointed with it. I have got a few albums on it, one of them is a progress record for the ongoing leg ulcer problem that I have had for a few years now. Some people think it's a bit strange, but, as I have had 2 keyhole surgeries, my surgeon said that they wished more people had a similar idea, as it gives them a better idea of the progress, and they have got more of an idea of what's going on! Brilliant! Just brilliant!! ððð
title: Love this app

review:
Since the redesign you no longer have access to the family vault. Instead, you have to move onto a web browser. 
Part of the reason this app was better to manage photos over Apple iCloud photos is the ability to have multiple people add photos which could be viewed/downloaded with ease as it was quick and easy to see who uploaded what to the vault. With that missing from the app there is very little point to it other than to view photos you, and you alone, have taken.
Best thing would be to reinstate this feature and it was one of the best things about the app.
title: Change isnât always a good thing

review:
Update - Nov 2017

Updated to 5* as not only have we now got editing features, but also People detection and Family sharing!
Now my Wife can upload her photos too and we can share photos in the Family Album section. 

People detection doesn't seem to be quite as accurate as Google's implementation though, so it needs a way to 'untag' those that it gets wrong, I can't see a way to do that at the moment. 

-----------------------------------------

Very good service, really like the 'This Day' feature to remind of years past. 
For me, to improve the uploading of photos, I use the brilliant PhotoSync app. This gives me more 'fine' control over the process, like renaming photos with my preferred date format & choosing which folder to upload to, which is great for separating different devices. It also triggers auto uploading by setting locations. 
Would give 5* if some basic editing features were added.
title: Very good ð

review: Iâve looked at all the photo apps and all have monthly charges, I just wanted to back up my photoâs away from home automatically in case of fire/hardrive damage, I didnât even plan to view the backup it was just for safekeeping. For under Â£20 a year I get this and the app which now lets me look at pics I havenât seen in years.. the face recognition is great as well.. ultimately (as I have prime anyway) this is amazing value and great functionality which is in addition to what I actually needed.
title: Ideal photo and video backup in case of fire/damage

review: Unlimited storage for your photos. Simple. How many people need to unload some storage from their phones? The app automatically syncs new photos, takes a few minutes if you do it once a fortnight. Not bad at all. The very first sync is time consuming, I had over 7000 photos, so can't complain about that. I really don't know why some people have given poor reviews here, seems like they can't use their phones and have blamed the app.
title: Brilliant app, recommend to everyone

review:
I have been worried about losing precious photos and videos for a while and had been looking at methods of how to store them. I have a hard drive back up but am always worried that this could fail. 
This App works seamlessly. I now have access to all my photos and videos wherever I am :-) 
Also happy to know I wonât lose precious memories because of a hard drive failure. It backs up whenever I take a photo or video. If Iâd known about this App beforehand I neednât have bothered buying a phone with so much storage.
title: Excellent

review:
This is a great little app which is free with prime, It has plenty of features like face recognition, filter by place etc, creating albums and sharing photos with people in the family vault. It also automatically backups all your photos when the app is open. 

My only issue is that when sharing holiday photos etc, it does not let you group them into an album in the family vault. So everyone ends up scrolling through a thousand photos to find the photos that they want.

Please implement albums in the family vault and this is 5*
title: Great Photo Storage

review:
The app generally works well and is very useful. There are however two problems I encounter with it. 

They are related. Every time I get a new phone or even sign out of the app it goes back over all the photos I have in iCloud (over 70,000 in my case) which seems to result in endless duplicates. I have as many as 5 copies of some photos. I am surprised the algorithm is unable to spot these duplicates. There is no easy way of removing them on either the desktop or mobile version and each has to be eliminated manually. I hope some automatic process can be included at some stage, even if it requires manual confirmation.
title: Good Apart From Duplicates

review: I love it. I honestly canât get enough of it. Itâs so easy to use and uploads all your photos and videos. It saves the ones youâve chosen as a favourite and keeps the in a folder separate but also in your main folder. Only this is that it struggles to upload Live Photoâs from your camera album. It saves them as a normal photos, which is fine because it doesnât effect it, it just means you canât see the short clip before and after. Apart from that, itâs amazing and Iâm glad I found it.
title: Space saver

review:
I've had multiple external hard drives fail on me over the years, losing thousands of photos in the process.
I hadn't realised prime offers photo storage at full quality. I use this with my whole family and it's great to share a family vault where we can all upload our pictures, much better than sharing degraded quality photos over WhatsApp!
Nice touch that it can categorise by people, locations, AI recognition objects etc.
The app alone will ensure that I renew my Prime subscription!
title: An absolutely brilliant app

review: I just wanted an app to store my wildlife photos and just needed something clean and easy to use and this does the trick. Just using the free version but reckon Iâll be happy to upgrade to fuller version through prime membership. I just like the simplicity of this app and speedy uploads where other services I have used seem to take forever. Iâve only had it a short while but early impressions leave me wanting to rate highly
title: Quick clean and easy uploading

review: Easy to install, use and love the fact it automatically uploads my photos so I donât have to worry about losing anything. My only wish is that all my videos would automatically upload, some of the videos on my phone uploaded but the storage facility for videos isnât unlimited and seemed to max out quickly and now I canât upload anything else, understand that you canât have it all though, for photos the storage facility is unlimited so thatâs amazing
title: Great for photos

review: I love this app as all my photos are in one place and safe. Four stars from me as there are a couple of issues Iâm struggling with. Video storage obviously takes up a lot more space and in just a week or so you need to start paying a subscription so saying itâs free is stretching the point, I donât upload videos. Itâs probably my age but finding one specific photo quickly isnât as easy as it is on other photo apps. Having said that itâs excellent and included with Prime for âfreeâ so Iâm happy ð
title: Great App

ALSO I canât change the order of photos from the same day and particularly in an album I have events all muddled up in timescale. This is a big need, to be able to see, for example, an event from start to finish and not people arriving, what happened halfway through, the beginning again, something from the middle of the day and so on.

Especially during the pandemic this has been a lifeline for all of us.
title: Great for family photo sharing

userName: cant get a nickname wonder why
review:
Great app showing my photos clearly and very easy to use. I set them to music and sent them to the people who are in them. They all loved them especially the parents. Definitely recommend and they definitely deserve 
5 stars.
title: Excellent photos

title: Great app

review:
I got the App to get my photos from my phone to my mumâs Echo Show but annoyingly I canât really control the family vault from the App, I have to log in on the web at the same time. Also somehow photos were uploading automatically even when I selected for that to not happen. Yet when I try to upload the photos manually I canât tell if it is working or not. There doesnât seem to be an icon or something telling me itâs happening. 
In short it could be a good and useful App but it isnât really and it is a shame I canât upload to the Echo show without it.
title: Family vault largely inaccessible

review:
Itâs good for scrolling through photos, uploading etc.
It needs a smarter search functionality.
e.g. If I want to search for photos of batteries or shower heads etc it doesnât really understand.
As a landlord, I need to be able to search for things by object name (battery, door handle, ceiling light, ADT sensor), or location that the photo was taken (e.g. North London rather than GPS or whatever. The current search fails to find most things unless itâs a face or date.
title: Itâs good but searching could be better

review: Incredible value for money. Works better than Flickr (although taking unlimited photo storage as if it were the only benefit of Prime you might argue Flickr's rate for storing original quality images is better, but I trust Prime more, and with all the other benefits, this is basically 'free') and iCloud just gives me hassles. Intelligent filing is amazing. As another review notes, some devices seem to sync faster than others, which can cause frustration..
title: Better than just a 'benefit' of Prime Membership

review:
Free unlimited photo back up with prime membership is excellent. Limited video storage but cost of extra space is much cheaper than other cloud storage.

Prime actually saves each and every photo taken whereas others select which they save and which they donât. (OneDrive)

Prime is great by itself for the shopping/postage side. The prime photos is and excellent and unexpected bonus.
title: Photo back up is an excellent feature.

review: I really like this app, itâs great that you can store unlimited photos here if you have prime and 5gb for videos is pretty good too. It handles well but the only thing I donât like is that you canât (or at least I canât find a way to do it) organise photos into folders, for me it would be better with this feature. You can make albums I think but you just canât store photos in different folders, they all get lumped in together.
title: Great app with one downside

review: This is a great app not only can you store all your video & pictures, you can send them to your fire stick.. the only issue is you can make a family file and transfer it to your fire stick, this would be great if it worked properly, Iâve got all my favourite pictures in the family file and canât get it on my stick. title: Photos

title: Started off great but has huge flaws

review:
Beware! Truthful update! The improvements have been delivered, however I am very disappointment over the removal of the originally touted âunlimited storageâ replaced by Â£79 per terabyte annually!
Quite simply that is not what I signed up for! Spent months uploading content to have the deal changed means pay-up or spend months moving it all again! 
Not cool at all! 

  âAmazing deal, still needs functionality tweaks, for which I have faith in evolution. Basically the blueprint has been laid for something monumental here!â
title: Amazin Prime

review: Love the app, the only thing that I would like to see to improve it would be 1) an album search function to make finding an album easier 2) being able to share albums with family (within family vault. review: This app has helped me keep all my old images when i had to get rid of my backup and i still have all my old photos thank you so much for helping me keep precious memories over the years when i had to wipe them off my camera roll,it would be nice to have a feature where you can send the images directly via iMessage though.
title: Thank you ð

review:
No search function, bizarre. Albums removed from main page, bizarre. How could anyone look at this update and think itâs better than how it was before? Bizarre.

I think even if your aim was to make the app as unusable as possible, even if you set out with that specific aim, you wouldnât be able to make it as bad as it currently is. It really is an achievement how youâve managed to take a fully functional app and make it utterly useless.
title: No search, albums gone

title: Great

title: Love it ðð

title: Fantastic storage

title: Not a fan of version 8.0.1

You used to be able to search âcatâ and it would show you all the pictures with cats. Now you have to scroll down, click âthingsâ and scroll through the list of 100âs of âthingsâ until you find cat

title: I find it complicated

title: Excellent

review:

title: Great

title: Useful app

review:

I could list 50 things that are wrong with this.

Why canât I use the family vault as before? Terrible.

Iâm off to Google photos - just so so bad, itâs worth moving.
